title: Configure Aidbox FHIR server
description:
Setup Aidbox FHIR server with architecture-as-code approach:

## Prerequisites
- AIDBOX_LICENSE_ID and AIDBOX_LICENSE_KEY from https://aidbox.app

## Implementation
1. Update .env.example with Aidbox license vars
2. Update docker-compose.yaml with correct Aidbox config
3. Create aidbox/ directory with seed data
4. Add infra/setup-aidbox.sh script that:
   - Validates license keys are set
   - Starts Aidbox container
   - Waits for health check
   - Loads demo FHIR resources

## Demo Data
- Sample Patient resources
- Sample Practitioner resources
- Sample Appointment resources
- Basic FHIR R4 resources for practice workflow

## Verification
- Aidbox UI accessible at :8080
- FHIR API responds at /fhir
- Demo data queryable

title: Setup OpenClaw for practice messaging
description:
Install and configure OpenClaw (formerly ClawdBot):
- Install OpenClaw on server
- Configure WhatsApp/Telegram integration
- Connect to Aidbox FHIR server
- Setup voice integration (ElevenLabs/Hume)

title: Claim hackathon perks
description:
Claim and configure API keys:
- ElevenLabs (3 months Creator) - Voice
- Hume AI (Creator mode) - Alternative voice
- n8n (1 month Pro) - Workflows
- OpenAI ($50 credits) - Backup LLM
- LangChain ($50 LangSmith) - Tracing
- Google DeepMind ($5 GCP)

title: Setup server environment
description:
Configure the ignis-hackathon server (167.235.236.238):
- Run setup-remote.sh to configure GitHub access
- Configure .env with API keys from hackathon perks
- Start Docker services (Aidbox, n8n)
- Verify all services running
